title: No, Cong Workers Didn’t Chant Pro-Pakistan Slogans in Rajsamand
subtitle: A video viral on social media claims that Congress workers in Rajasthan’s Rajsamand raised slogans of ‘Pakistan Zindabad’ slogans at what appears to be a party meeting.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
Speaking to The Quint, Shaikh further clarified that the video was from a 25 November event held at Rajsamand’s Kankroli.

“If you hear carefully, the workers gathered are not raising Pakistan Zindabad slogans, but are saying ‘Bhaati-saab Zindabad’, hailing Narayan Singh Bhaati, the Congress candidate from that constituency,” he said.

He added that although he had tagged the Rajasthan Police in his tweet to bring it to their notice, he was yet to receive a response.

However, instead of actively pursuing a legal route, the Congress now plans to put out a counter video clearly specifying the details to dispel the misinformation surrounding it, Shaikh said.
